definition: Getting Home, 2007 PRC comedy-drama film directed by 張揚|张扬[Zhang1 Yang2], starring 趙本山|赵本山[Zhao4 Ben3 shan1]
lit. a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom)/fig. all things go back to their source eventually/in old age, an expatriate returns home
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
leaf/page/lobe/(historical) period/classifier for small boats
surname Ye
surname Gui

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
see 樹高千丈，葉落歸根|树高千丈，叶落归根[shu4 gao1 qian1 zhang4 , ye4 luo4 gui1 gen1]
pinyin: shu4 gao1 qian1 zhang4 , luo4 ye4 gui1 gen1

sentences.english: It's home, so that's where I'll be.
sentences.chinese: 到家了，這正是我想落葉歸根之處。

sentences.english: Though a tree grow ever so high, the falling leaves return to the ground.
Ultimately, never leaves and unable to resist autumn only regret lifelong.
sentences.chinese: 落葉歸根，千萬別在無力抵擋秋風時才悔恨終身。

sentences.english: As an inhabitant of a foreign country, the willingness to return to his ancestral home always lingers in the old man's mind.
sentences.chinese: 落葉歸根的情懷一直縈繞在身處異國他鄉的老人心中。

definition: to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
to die/euphemism, lit. to return West or to the Western Paradise
a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
time flies (idiom)
fortunes rise and fall/times change
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to sigh/to heave a sigh
Misty Poetry, a post-Cultural Revolution poetry movement
lie/false words/nonsense/CL:篇[pian1]
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
survival of the fittest
to force someone to do something
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
